revised_title: The Prickly Pear and Indigo Plant's Effects on Animal Juices Coloring
tldr: The author shares a letter from Dr. Alexander Garden, who conducted experiments on the effects of the Opuntia (prickly pear) and Indigo plant on the coloring of animal juices. Dr. Garden observed that the prickly pear caused a red color in the urine of tested subjects, while the indigo plant dyed cow's milk blue. This led to further experiments and potential future research on the plants' dye-producing properties.
